title: PREVIEW: Grass, The Point, Eastleigh
text:
0 comments 
THE ground beneath our feet will be brought to life in a new dance performance for families coming to The Point this weekend. 
Look down. What are you standing on? Explore the ground and all of its wriggling inhabitants in this quirky dance show for young children by Second Hand Dance. 
Featuring worms, slugs, snails, spontaneous outbreaks of ant dancing and plenty of obscure insect-related facts, Grass uses performance, puppetry and projection to inspire children to look closely at the world around them., to get mucky and play! Share article 
Directed and choreographed by Rosie Heafford, Grass is on at The Point tomorrow at 2pm and is suitable for ages over four and up. 
Call 023 8065 2333 or see thepointeastleigh.co.uk. Promoted Stories PREVIEW: Grass, The Point, Eastleigh Sorry, an error occurred.
